totally rewrite the recognizer task to use a separate thread for audio to deal with sub-realtime performance, and to be robust and threadsafe (probably there is a java.util.concurrency or some other pattern for this but oh well we did it the hard way) - also the demo minimally works now in that it recognizes speech and puts it on the screen.  cool!

git-svn-id: svn+ssh://svn.code.sf.net/p/cmusphinx/code/trunk/PocketSphinxAndroidDemo@10226 94700074-3cef-4d97-a70e-9c8c206c02f5

oh, this is not an Android bug, it is just a non-obvious Java thing - the monitor is a property of the object, not the variable, so if we assign to this.mailbox, we will still be holding the monitor on the old object but not on the new one, and thus calling notify() will fail.  duh!
